intro: Bengt-jonsellia tsaratananae, commonly known as the Tsaratanana bengt-jonsellia, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the northeastern region of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments, where it relies on specific soil conditions and microclimates for survival. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a critically endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
